a conference last month, said there`` has been this nervousness, partly as a result of listening to political consultants... that you can't seem to be threatening voters'' about voting for taxes. There's this worry about the optics of all that. I understand that- voters don't want to be threatened, and voters shouldn't be threatened, Bill Lockyer said.`` However, you also have to be honest with them about what the consequences will be if the only policy option is an all-cut budget. And no one has yet produced that.''

defenses have their work cut out for them trying to get to those guys,'' said John Kuhn , a running back who broke into the NFL taking handoffs from Ben Roethlisberger , but now plays behind Aaron Rodgers . When defenses get to them, it's not over. They've got to get them to the ground. Against Atlanta, Aaron Rodgers made like four or five guys miss in the pocket on several different plays. He's phenomenal. He's playing at a high level right now. But with Ben Roethlisberger , you can't tackle him. He's a beast back there. I think people underestimate how big and strong he actually is. The 6-foot-2, 225-pound Aaron Rodgers ran for 23.8 yards per game this season, the most among all quarterbacks other than Michael Vick .
